item.description: Ontario has officially launched its new immigration website:Ontarioimmigration.ca . The online resource appeals to immigrants who choose to make the Province their new home in Canada.

item.title: Survey of Recent Immigrants to Canada Shows High Level of Satisfaction, According to Survey
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Four years ago, Statistics Canada launched a new program tracking the successes, challenges and attitudes of new immigrants to Canada over a number of years. The first crop of results are in, and recent immigrants are giving the thumbs-up to their newly adopted nation.

item.title: Strategic Plan to Foster Immigration to Francophone Minority Communities
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Minister of Citizenship and Immigration was recently in Winnipeg to help launch a five-year "Strategic Plan" to Foster Immigration to Francophone Minority Communities. This plan aims to increase immigration of French-speaking people to Francophone communities.

item.title: Storytelling Initiative Celebrates Contributions Made by Immigrants to Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In an effort to shed light on the important contributions made across Canada by immigrants, an innovative program is bringing their stories throughout the country. The Passages to Canada program brings first hand accounts of immigrant experiences and contributions to Canadian society to a variety of different audiences.

item.title: Spousal Sponsorship Changes
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On February 18, 2005 the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration announced that spouses and common-law partners in a genuine relationship with a Canadian citizen or permanent resident, regardless of immigration status, are able to apply for permanent residence status while remaining in Canada.

item.title: Some Canadians Must Apply to Retain Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Days before leaving the post of Minister of Citizenship and Immigration to become Minister of Human Resources and Social Development, the Honourable Monte Solberg sent a letter to Members of Parliament (MP) reminding them that some Canadians' citizenships may lapse if they do not re-apply prior to their 28th birthday.

item.title: Small rural communities in Canada working to attract immigrants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Community Immigration Retention in Rural Ontario (CIRRO) pilot project was recently launched by the Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food, and Rural Affairs to create a list of best practices for small communities welcoming immigrants.

item.title: Small Business Association Calls for Easier Entry for Non-Professional Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In a report released on labour shortages faced by small and medium sized firms across Canada, the Canadian Federation of Independent Business (CFIB) called for changes to the immigration system to better meet their needs.

item.title: Skilled Immigrants in High Demand as Unemployment Matches 30-Year Low
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Driven by greater than expected job creation in December, Canada's unemployment rate fell back down to the 30-year low previously reached in May 2006.

item.title: Simplified Application Process Introduced for Federal Skilled Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new simplified application process seeks to expedite the permanent resident application queue.

item.title: Saskatchewan Invests Further in Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Saskatchewan has recently announced an $8.5 million infusion of funds into immigration and settlement services for the 2007-2008 fiscal year. This budget represents a 40 per cent increase over 2006-2007.

item.title: Safe-third country act denies refugees their inalienable rights
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Amnesty International, as well as The Canadian Counsel for Refugees (CCR), has voiced their collective concern over the real-world implications regarding the Canada/US "Safe-Third Country Agreement". The human rights advocacy groups believe that procedures initiated through this legislation may in effect obstruct valid refugee claimants from gaining access to Canada's refugee determination system.

item.title: Right of Permanent Resident Fee reduced by half
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada has reduced the Right of Permanent Residence Fee (RPRF) from C$975.00 to C$490.00 effective Wednesday, May 3, 2006.

item.title: Renewal of Canadian Permanent Resident Cards for International Travel
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian permanent resident (PR) card was first introduced in June 2002 in order to heighten Canada’s border security and provide immigrants with secure and convenient proof of their status in Canada. Valid for a five year period, the cards that were first issued in 2002 will begin expiring in the coming months.

item.title: Quebec Annual Action Week Against Racism Begins
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In its eighth consecutive year, Quebec’s Action Week Against Racism is a clear indication that the province is open and welcoming to diverse cultural groups and that it is working to ease the settlement and integration of newcomers into Quebec society. The theme of this year’s event is The Workplace: A Racism-Free Zone and it is dedicated to encouraging the open discussion and development of ideas to make Quebec a society free of any discrimination. Given the importance ofQuebec immigration to maintaining population and economic growth, the ideas and results that come from this week will be very valuable to all Quebec society.

item.title: Quebec amends Work Permit rules for international students
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new agreement between the Quebec government and the Government of Canada grants international students the right to seek off-campus work in all regions of Quebec, including Montréal and Québec City. Nearly one hundred schools across the province are eligible to participate under the newly tabled regulation.

item.title: Quality of Life Will Attract Immigrants, say Atlantic Canada Mayors
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: While recent Canadian census told of the importance of immigration for Canadian growth, cities and provinces across Canada are devising strategies to attract newcomers to their region. The mayors of Atlantic Canada are confident that the quality of life in their cities will be the key to attracting immigrants to work, live and stay in their cities and towns.

item.title: Protesters pre-empt immigration minister's speech
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Thursday June 01, 2006 – Roughly a dozen dissenters began vociferously objecting to government policy regarding deportations as Federal Immigration Minister Monte Solberg took the stage at a downtown church in the nation’s capital yesterday.

item.title: New Project Intended to Speed-Up Temporary Work Permit Processing
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Immigration Minister Monte Solberg announced yesterday his government's plan to facilitate the entry of foreign workers.

item.title: New law will ease the way for professional credentials recognition in Quebec
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Foreign-trained doctors, nurses and other professionals will be offered a "fast-track" to credentials recognition in Quebec with the introduction of Bill 14.

item.title: Ottawa a Growing Sector of Employment in Technology
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A study by CIBC's World Markets Inc. ranks Ottawa first for strongest economic momentum, attributing growth to the Technology sector and Federal Government. Experts agree that economic strength in Canadian cities is due to population and economic diversity.

item.title: Ontario website matches skilled immigrants with employers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Skillsinternational.ca allows prospective employers and skilled Canadian immigrants to find each other. The website is the first of its kind in Canada.

item.title: Ontario Opposition Leader Unveils Plan to Integrate Skilled Immigrants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In a new policy paper, Ontario Progressive Conservative (PC) Party leader John Tory revealed his party’s plan to assist skilled immigrants arriving in the province.

item.title: Ontario Names New Commissioner for Recognition of Foreign Credentials
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Following from new legislation passed in late 2006, the Province of Ontario has appointed its first ever Fairness Commissioner to work with regulatory bodies for the recognition of the credentials of internationally trained professionals. The role of Fairness Commissioner is a key component of the Fair Access to Regulated Professions Act, 2006, which became law on March 1, 2007.

item.title: Ontario Launches Government Outreach Program to Help Newcomers Succeed in the Workplace
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The McGuinty government is lending a helping hand to newcomers. Ontario's new initiative is aimed at aiding newly-landed immigrants understand theirrights and responsibilities in Canada so that they can stay safe and prosper in the workplace.

item.title: Ontario to introduce new Fair Access to Regulated Professions Act
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The proposed bill, if passed, will break down barriers that will ensure foreign-trained professionals have a fair chance at finding work in their field of expertise in Canada.

item.title: Ontario Eases Process for Temporary Worker Permits
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Following the model of programs in British Columbia, Alberta and Saskatchewan, the province of Ontario has reached an agreement with Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) to ease entry for foreign workers in high demand professions.

item.title: Ontario Community Website Connects Immigrants to Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In its effort to boost regional immigration, the province of Ontario is funding a community website focused on attracting Canadian immigrants to suburban London, Ontario.

item.title: Ontario Commits New Funding for Foreign-Trained Nurses
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In recent years, the Canadian healthcare system has experienced a shortage of nurses, as many experienced professionals retire. To ensure fair treatment and to ease the burden on the healthcare system, the Government of Ontario is taking steps to help foreign-trained nurses work in Ontario.

item.title: Ontario Announces New Pilot Provincial Nominee Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Ontario government has introduced the Ontario Pilot Provincial Nominee Program(PNP) designed to help Ontario employers to attract and retain the skilled immigrants needed in the provincial labour market.

item.title: Nova Scotia Industry Leaders Call for More Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The leaders of some of Atlantic Canada's largest industry organizations are looking to work with Citizenship and Immigration Canada to encourage more immigrants to come to their region.

item.title: Non-Profit Group Launches New Initiative to Encourage Civic Engagement among Immigrants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Nearly a fifth of Canada's total population was born elsewhere in the world. Many of these individuals immigrated to Canada because of the promise of living freely in a democratic, peaceful and multicultural society. Studies have shown however, that immigrants to Canada have low levels of political participation. A new program being run by The Maytree Foundation aims to change that by encouraging civic engagement among immigrants.

item.title: No change to overall Immigration numbers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada's new immigration minister says the Conservative Government does not plan to change the overall immigration target number, or restrict family reunification.

item.title: No Amnesty for Undocumented Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada will not be allowing an amnesty for undocumented workers despite calls from community groups, unions and industry associations.

item.title: New processing procedures for Gulf residents
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Gulf residents applying for Canadian permanent residency in pre-defined categories will be processed through the Abu Dhabi Embassy, instead of the previous London (UK) Visa Office beginning on January 1, 2006.

item.title: New Passport Rule to Take Effect
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Beginning January 23, 2007, Canadians travelling to and from the United States by air will require a passport. While the rule will apply to those who cross the border by land in the future, this regulation will not take effect until at least 2008.

item.title: New International Graduate Immigration Stream in Nova Scotia
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Nova Scotia Office of Immigration recently introduced a new division of its Provincial Nominee Program. The International Graduate stream was launched in response to the immigration strategy consultations that the Office of Immigration has been conducting with employers around the province.

item.title: New Government Office Launched to Help Foreign Professionals get Credentials Recognized
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada is acting to help immigrants work in their chosen fields in Canada. In order to overcome the delays and difficulties of getting foreign credentials recognized in Canada, a new government office will provide services to newcomers to assist in navigating the credential recognition process.

item.title: New friends in Ottawa means more help for Alberta
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: "The West has wanted in, the West is in now." PM Harper told supporters at a victory speech after his party's meager minority defeat. Harper's sentiment underlines the hope Alberta has that the Conservative Government will help the province approve a draft strategy regarding labour shortage.

item.title: Newfoundland and Labrador Government Allot Millions to Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Only about 150 of the 250,000 immigrants who come to Canada every year choose to settle permanently in Newfoundland and Labrador. The provincial government intends to triple that number.

item.title: New Employment Resource Centre Will Help Immigrants Enter Canadian Job Market
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In Brampton, Ontario, a fast-growing suburb of Toronto, a new centre has opened its doors to offer a broad range of services aimed to help immigrants navigate the Canadian job market. The Brampton Employment Resource Centre is an initiative funded by Citizenship and Immigration Canada to provide information and services to help newcomers build bridges into employment.

item.title: New Competition Celebrates Immigration in Canadian Culture
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As a multicultural society, Canadian culture is shaped by the contributions of immigrants. A new competition being run by Radio Canada International is celebrating this contribution by inviting young people in Canada to use their artistic skills to tell stories about immigrating to Canada.

item.title: New Canada Immigration Initiatives
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Immigration Minister Announces Tripling of the Number of Parents and Grandparents Immigrating to Canada every yearThe measures to speed up the processing of sponsorship applications for parents and grandparents coming to Canada as family class immigrants includetripling the number of parents and grandparents who can immigrate to Canada from 6,000 to 18,000 a year in 2005 and in 2006.

item.title: Fredericton, New Brunswick, on the threshold of a business explosion
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: With a populous and impending generation of retiring workers, Fredericton focuses on regional immigration as a means to supplement their workforce and bolster their booming economy.

item.title: New Brunswick Creating Additional Immigration Incentives
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The latest national census confirmed that, though the population of New Brunswick has not decreased over the past five years, it has not seen much growth either. Greg Byrne, the minister responsible for the population growth secretariat has underlined the importance of encouraging people to settle in New Brunswick and to stay there.

item.title: New Book Celebrates Filipino-Canadian History
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After a half-century of immigration, Canada has the second largest community of Filipinos in the world outside of the Philippines itself. Overtime this community has grown to number 315,000, accounting for one per cent of the total Canadian population. A new book written by two Filipino-Canadians celebrates the Filipino community in Canada and its history.

item.title: New Agreement for Canada-Alberta Cooperation on Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new immigration agreement has been signed today by the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration Canada, Diane Finley, the Alberta Minister of Employment, Immigration, and Industry, Iris Evans, and the Premier of Alberta, Ed Stelmach. The Agreement for Canada-Alberta Cooperation on Immigration is a commitment from the federal government to work collaboratively on immigration matters with the Province of Alberta. It is designed to address Alberta’s labour force needs and the needs of newcomers to the province.

item.title: MPs Speak Out for Dual Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Several Canadian Members of Parliament (MP) have spoken up recently in defence of dual citizenship. Their comments came in response to recent calls for the newly elected leader of the Liberal Party of Canada Stephane Dion.

item.title: So you want to move to Canada?
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
By Kevin Berger
Nov. 4, 2004

David Cohen, partner of Cohen-Campbell, a leading Canadian immigration law firm, had barely settled into work Wednesday morning when his phone startedringing with Americans seeking legal guidance to taking up residence in the land of the maple leaf. The Bush victory did it, they told him: America's shiftto the right had finally squeezed them out of their own country. Farewell Ten Commandment statues in public squares, hello single-payer healthcare.

item.title: More skilled workers needed to fuel Western Canada's Oil and Gas industries
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada's aging population, coupled with the current economic boom, leaves key Alberta growth industries clamoring for skilled workers.

item.title: Immigration minister to outline government's vision for Canada's "outdated" immigration system
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Federal Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, the Honourable Monte Solberg, will address a National Business Symposium on June 15th. The discussion is expected to explore solutions to Canada's massive labour shortage. The gathering will be held at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Minister Kenney issues new instructions for Federal Skilled Worker applications
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship, Immigration and Multiculturalism Canada (CIMC) Minister Jason Kenney has announced the Canadian Government’s plan for immigration in 2009. He stated that between 240,000 and 265,000 new permanent residents will be welcomed to Canada in 2009; up to 156,000 of them in the economic category.

item.title: Microsoft Chairman Bill Gates says "Best and Brightest are Headed to Canada"
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: While appearing before a committee of the United States Senate, Microsoft founder and Chairman Bill Gates noted that Canada is attracting the best and brightest immigrants to its borders. Gates suggested that his home country had much to learn from its Northern neighbour in terms of immigration policy.

item.title: President Vincente Fox is pitching his solution to Canada's massive labor shortages
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Fox proposes that Mexican workers be able to work in Canada temporarily, a solution that borrows its concept from Canada's Seasonal Agricultural Workers Program.

item.title: Mexico is Canada's biggest source of refugees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Mexico, which is part of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), has risen to the top of Canada's refugee claimant list.

item.title: Canadian Company Concerned that Foreign Workers Paid for Jobs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Maple Leaf Foods has abandoned its program at its Brandon, Manitoba plant to bring in workers from China, after it was revealed that 61 workers had paid fees of $10,000 to the immigration consultant hired by the company. The actions were not illegal, however the company was concerned about the debt burden faced by the employees.

item.title: Without this input from abroad, Manitoba would have lost population
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: According to Statistics Canada (Statscan), Alberta's population increased by five times the national average in the fourth quarter of 2005. The Prairie province has not seen growth of this magnitude since it struck oil in the late 1970s.

item.title: Manitoba - Skilled Worker Recruitment Initiative in Europe
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Manitoba government is being proactive in its search for foreign skilled workers who are qualified to alleviate labour shortages in the province.

item.title: Liberals demand Conservatives Provide Funding for Immigration Plan for Francophone Communities
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Liberal Citizenship and Immigration Critic Raymonde Folco today called on the Conservative government to deliver the funding required to foster greater immigration for minority Francophone communities.

item.title: Liberal Party Names new Critic for Citizenship and Immigration in Shadow Cabinet
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As recently elected Liberal Party of Canada leader the Honourable Stephane Dion named his first shadow cabinet, a new face will be addressing issues of Citizenship and Immigration. The announcement also features some prominent roles for former Ministers of Citizenship and Immigration.

item.title: Layton Joins Indo-Canadians in Calling for Apology for Komagata Maru Incident
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Federal NDP leader Jack Layton called on the government to issue a formal apology in the House of Commons for a case of racism against immigrants from India 93 years ago. In 1914 the Komagata Maru was marooned in Vancouver's harbour for three months with nearly 400 passengers on board, and eventually sent back to Asia.

item.title: Canada experiencing one of the most serious labour shortages in the industrial world
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada's labour crunch has it facing one of the most serious shortages of skilled workers in the industrial world. A recent Manpower inc. poll of Canadian small and enterprise-level business highlights the growing trend.

item.title: Iraqi Refugee Claims Reaching High Levels of Success in Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Refugees arriving in Canada from Iraq since 2003 have found a relatively high rate of approval for their claims. The UN High Commission for Refugees has commended Canada’s response to the Iraqi refugee crisis.

item.title: International Survey Ranks Canadian Cities Tops for Healthy Living and Quality of Life
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In an international study conducted by Mercer Human Resource Consulting, the city of Calgary has ranked at the top of its Health and Sanitation index. Canadian cities also ranked very high for indicators of quality of life.

item.title: International students studying in Canada can now apply for off-campus work permits
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Honourable Monte Solberg, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, has announced that effective April 27, 2006, foreign students enrolled in public post-secondary institutions can apply for off-campus work permits. The work permit is valid for the duration of their study permit.

item.title: Improved Immigration Policy a Primary Platform in the Liberal Leadership Race
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Maurizio Bevilacqua distinguishes himself in the Liberal Leadership race with a platform based on a radical overhaul of the Canadian Immigration Policy.

item.title: Canada’s Immigration Minister visits Europe, highlighting Canada’s commitment to fight anti-Semitism
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship, Immigration and Multiculturalism Canada Minister Jason Kenney returned from an official visit to Europe on Thursday, during which he announced Canada’s full membership in the Task Force for International Cooperation on Holocaust Education, Remembrance and Research (ITF).

item.title: CIC Update on the Middle East: Immigration and Evacuation from Lebanon
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: CIC continues to process immigration applications to Canada while Government prepares evacuation of Canadian citizens.

item.title: Immigrant Entrepreneurs Fast-Tracked to British Colombia
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Minister of Citizenship & Immigration and the Economic Development Department of British Colombia made the announcement on August 22, 2006 that a Memorandum of Understanding had been signed, which would help Immigrant entrepreneurs expedite the process in establishing themselves in British Colombia.

item.title: Canada's underground immigrant economy costing million
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Ontario Construction Secretariat estimates that the province alone loses over 1.5 billion dollars in unpaid taxes and premiums annually to the underground immigrant economy. Amid deportation hearings, officials in Canada are wondering what to do with all these illegal workers.

item.title: Ignatieff Calls for Streamlined Immigration Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Liberal leadership candidate Michael Ignatieff said on Friday in Vancouver that Canada needs to expand the family-class portion of its immigration system, which allows Canadians to sponsor family members who want to become permanent residents of Canada. He also said that the Canadian immigration system needs to be "streamlined" which would include a processing system based in Canada.

item.title: Happy Labor Day Wishes
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Today, September 4, 2006, is a holiday across the entire Canada/USA region, known as "Labor Day".

item.title: Guaranteed Working Income Being Considered In British Columbia (B.C)
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A guaranteed working income of $25,000 for every Canadian would ensure a more comfortable life for those struggling to make a living in Whistler, British Columbia says Blair Wilson, the Member of Parliament for West Vancouver-Sunshine Coast-Sea to Sky Country.

item.title: Government to Raise Immigration Target for 2007
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In its annual report to the House of Commons, Citizenship and Immigration Canada announced Tuesday that the target for permanent residents will increase by 15,000 in the upcoming year.

item.title: New government agency will recognize foreign credentials to "cut through the red tape"
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In his first public address as Immigration Minister, Monte Solberg announced that a federal agency will be developed to respond to the needs of Canada's skilled immigrants. He also re-iterated his government's plan to reduce the immigrant landing fee by half.

item.title: From London Bobby to Calgary Police Officer
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Calgary police force journeys "across the pond" to the United Kingdom (UK) in search of officers.

item.title: Foreign Workers Program Not Meeting The Needs of Canadian Businesses
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new report by the Canadian Bar Association claims that a federal program aimed at bringing low-skilled foreign workers into Canada is not meeting the needs of employers in dire need of staff. The challenge regarding the program is that it only allows workers to stay in Canada a maximum of 12 months.

item.title: Foreign credentials recognized in a Conservative Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Monday January 23, 2006 - The votes are in and Canadians have chosen a new Prime-Minister in Stephen Harper, and a new direction for Canada.

item.title: Forced To Leave Canada Today
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Immigration Officials won't bend rules to permit live-in caregiver to stay in Canada

item.title: First Head Tax Restitution Payments Arrive for Chinese-Canadians
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Federal Government has begun to make its payments to members of the Chinese community who were forced to pay a head tax when immigrating to Canada between 1885 and 1923.

item.title: New fairness commissioner would make regulatory bodies accountable for how they treat immigrants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: New legislation would have Ontario's 34 regulated professions face scrutiny by a new 'fairness commissioner', ensuring their admission procedures are clear, open and fair to all.

item.title: Exploitation Of Filipino Nurses
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Vancouver based Filipino Nurses Support Group (FNSG) has alleged that Filipino nurses who come to Canada are being taken advantage of.

item.title: Employers in Saskatoon Better Equipped to Hire Immigrants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: An immigration office will be opening in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan on June 15, 2007 as part of the provincial government’s plan to develop, attract, and retain its workforce. The immigration office will provide support for Saskatoon employers interested in hiring immigrants. Additionally, it will provide assistance and information to providers of integration services for newcomers.

item.title: Edmonton wants federal government to streamline immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A survey by Manpower Inc. found that Edmonton's net employment is anticipated to grow by 48 per cent, compared to thenational net employmentoutlook of 29 per cent.

item.title: Economic Integration of Immigrants: Better in Small Canadian Areas
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: According to a recent Statistics Canada report, immigrants who settle in smaller Canadian cities and rural areas are better off financially than those who head to larger urban areas. The Perspectives on Labour and Income study finds that the earnings gap between newcomers and Canadians is significantly less in smaller towns than in big cities. Furthermore, that gap narrows much more quickly in small towns.

item.title: Doubts exist over CSIC's competence
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: With the resignation of four board members in less than four months, The Canadian Bar Association (CBA) expressing concern, and an independent auditor describing its expenses as "unusually high", the Canadian Society of Immigration Consultants (CSIC) is raising considerable doubt over its ability to self-govern.

item.title: Dion Stresses Importance of Immigration for Canadian Economy
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Speaking with members of the Chinese community in Markham, just outside of Toronto, newly elected leader of the Liberal Party of Canada Stephane Dion discussed his plans to keep Canada competitive in the global economy. Mr. Dion highlighted immigration as a crucial element, helping to address Canada's labour shortage.

item.title: Development of the IT Industry in Nova Scotia Means More IT Work in Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: There will be an increasing number of Canadian jobs in the Information Technology sector as the province of Nova Scotia embarks on a campaign to grow anddevelop the province’s IT industry.

item.title: Cricket in Canada - Immigration Fueling the Game
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian immigrants who originate from the Indian subcontinent are helping to make cricket a popular sport in Canada. Mike Colle, Minister for Immigration and Citizenship in Ontario, is presently in St. Lucia to encourage the Canadian team at the cricket World Cup.

item.title: Canada's new Conservative Minister of Citizenship and Immigration Announced Today
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Monte Solberg, a western MP stemming from Calgary, Alberta, has been appointed Canada's new Minister of Citizenship and Immigration. Solberg was the finance critic from 2003 to 2005 and has been a long-serving member in the House of Commons.

item.title: Commission to Explore How to Improve the Immigrant Settlement Process in Quebec
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Consultation Commission on Accommodation Practices Related to Cultural Differences will be holding public hearings and town hall meetings in 17Quebeccommunities this fall. Having done five months of research and focus groups, the Commission's public hearings will give immigrants, French-speakingQuebecers and English-speaking Quebecers a chance to come together and discuss perceptions about immigration in Quebec.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada to Increase Settlement Funding
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In response to the demand for skilled immigrant workers in the Canadian economy, the Canadian government will be increasing funding for immigrant settlement programs by $307 million over the next 2 years.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Spruces Up Website for Improved User Experience
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In order to better serve its visitors, the Citizenship and Immigration Canada website (www.cic.gc.ca) has been reorganized to facilitate navigation and to improve user experience.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Moves to Ease Temporary Worker Permit
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As businesses in Western Canada continue to experience shortages of labour, the Honourable Monte Solberg, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, announced changes to make it easier for companies to hire foreign workers.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Extends Length of Certain Temporary Foreign Worker Permits
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In a move aimed to capitalize on the contributions being made by foreign workers to the booming Canadian economy, the Canadian Ministry of Citizenship and Immigration along with of Human Resources and Social Development Canada (ESDC) have announced that they will be extending the length of certain Temporary Foreign Worker permits.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Committed to Recognizing Foreign Credentials
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Honourable Diane Finley, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced yesterday that she will be working closely with the HonourableMonte Solberg and Human Resources and Social Development Canada (ESDC) to create an office for the Canadian recognition of foreign work credentials.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Changes Visa Requirement for Estonian Citizens
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As announced on September 28, 2006 by the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Monte Solberg, after an analysis done by Canada, Estonian citizens no longer require a temporary resident visa to visit Canada. He said this was due to the fact that Canada has the largest community of Estonians outside of Estonia.

item.title: CIC Celebrates Chinese New Year with Funding for Ottawa's Chinese Community
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Minister Diane Finely rang in the Chinese Lunar New Year at the Ottawa Chinese Community Service Centre, where sheannounced new funding for the centre.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Accepts Humanitarian and Compassionate Claim
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After three years living in a Vancouver church, Amir Kazemian is free to stay in Canada, as his application has been approved by Citizenship and Immigration Canada on humanitarian and compassionate grounds. The welcome news reached Mr. Kazemian in the nick of time, as he was in police custody awaiting deportation.

item.title: CIMC Minister to visit India to review and discuss Canadian immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship, Immigration, and Multiculturalism Canada (CIMC) Minister Jason Kenney will be heading to New Delhi, Amritsar, Chandigarh, and Mumbai fromJanuary 11 to 18. He will be reviewing Canadian immigration operations in India and meeting with his India counterparts to discuss recent changes in Canadian immigration policy and to work on further strengthening relations between the two countries.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Minister Monte Solberg to make first public address
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In Solberg's first public address as Minister, he is expected to speak on issues which "affect the successful integration of immigrants into the Canadian society". The meeting will focus on various topics including how Canada can better address foreign skill and credential recognition.

item.title: Canadians Tops in Tolerance, According to Survey
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada has plenty to be proud of this week thanks to a study showing the successes of multiculturalism in the country. In a survey of 23 countries in the Western world, Canadians showed themselves to be among the most tolerant across the board in the categories measured.

item.title: Canadians Receive High Marks in International Survey on Quality of Life
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: There is cause for celebration in Canada today, as a survey of 16 countries shows Canadians to be leading the back in health, happiness and quality of life. According to the survey, this news should be quite well received, as over 90 percent of working Canadians described themselves as happy, with the figure jumping to 95 percent for retirees.

item.title: Government plans to make it easier for Canadian parents to adopt foreign-born children
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Monday, May 15, 2006 - the Honourable Monte Solberg, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, introduced a new bill in the House of Commons to reform the Citizenship Act. The plan is intended to streamline the foreign adoption process by amending bureaucratic hurdles that lengthen the time it takes to unite Canadian parents with their foreign-adopted children.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Destination: Saskatchewan
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Both rural and urban communities in the province of Saskatchewan saw significant increases in immigration in the past year. The Saskatchewan Immigrant Nominee Program (SINP) attracted over one thousand nominations in 2006, the largest number to date, which added to the 26 per cent rise in the annual number of immigrants landing in the province. With 2,658 landed immigrants in 2006, the government of Saskatchewan is continuing to implement its “bold strategy to attract 5,000 newcomers annually by 2008.”

item.title: Canadian Immigration Critical for Population Growth
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Statistics Canada’s most recent census, which covers the period from 2001-2006, indicates that immigrants to Canada are responsible for two thirds of the country’s population growth. With the total Canadian population swelling to 31.6 million, the Canada-born populace increase of 400,000 was well outdone by the additional 1.2 million immigrants over the five-year span of the census.

item.title: Landmark Express Entry Draw: Lowest CRS Points Requirement Ever
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The thirteenth draw for Canadian immigration through the Express Entry selection system was performed by Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) on July 17, 2015. A total of 1,581 invitations to apply (ITAs) for Canadian permanent residence were issued to candidates with 451 or more Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) points.

item.title: Canadian immigration application submission process revised - Federal Skilled Worker
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has issued ministerial instructions that change the way Federal Skilled Worker applications are submitted tothe Canadian immigration visa office.

item.title: Quebec study finds that seven out of 10 immigrants secure work in their chosen profession
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A study commissioned by Quebec's immigration minister contends that the idea of a foreign-trained immigrant driving a taxi cab to make ends-meat is an overstated pretense.

item.title: Canadian Government Launches Program to Improve Skilled Immigrant Workplace Integration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On February 28, the Honourable Monte Solberg, Minister of Human Resources and Social Development Canada (ESDC), announced a new Canadian immigration initiative to increase the involvement of Canadian immigrants in the workplace.

item.title: Canadian Economy off to Hot Start in 2007
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: While an unseasonable cold burst means that the arrival of spring has not yet brought much improvement in the weather, the spirit of growth and renewal of the season may be seen in the Canadian economy. In the month of March, job growth in Canada exceeded expectations by 500 percent, capping off a record first quarter.

item.title: Canadian Citizenship Week 2006
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, the Honourable Monte Solberg, launched Canada's Citizenship Week 2006. He marked the occasion by taking part in a special citizenship ceremony swearing in 35 new Canadians.

item.title: Canada Welcomes New Minister of Citizenship and Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As Prime Minister Stephen Harper shuffles his cabinet, it has been announced that the Honourable Diane Finley will become the new Minister of Citizenship and Immigration. The Honourable Monte Solberg will be moving on to become Minister of Human Resources and Social Development.

item.title: Canada Opening its Doors to Resettle 5,000 Bhutanese Refugees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As a wealthy and democratic country that has been built on immigration, Canada has a long-standing tradition of opening its borders to individuals seeking asylum from persecution or unsafe conditions. In the spirit of this tradition, Canada will be opening its doors to over 5,000 refugees from Bhutan who have been living in refugee camps in Nepal for over a decade.

item.title: Canada to Recognize Same-Sex Marriages Performed Abroad for Immigration Purposes
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In an announcement earlier this week, Citizenship and Immigration Canada has stated that Canada will now recognize same-sex marriages performed abroad for all immigration purposes. While Same-sex marriage is legal in Canada, until now the Canadian government had only recognized those unions performed in Canada.

item.title: Canada to Fast-Track Immigration of Foreign Clergy
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In response to the demands of faith communities across the country, Citizenship and Immigration Canada is examining ways to make it easier for religious leaders to obtain landed immigrant status. Many of these clergy arrive to serve communities on temporary resident visas but are unable to meet the requirements for permanent residents.

item.title: Canada to Accept An Additional 2000 Karen Refugees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada will be opening its doors to 2,000 refugees of the Karen ethnic group, in a move announced by the Honourable Diane Finley, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration. Canada first accepted a group of 810 Karen in 2006 for resettlement.

item.title: Canada's Technology Sector Calls for More Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: At a conference of Information Technology industry leaders, skilled workers, and educational institutions, a consensus was made clear: Canada’s IT needs more immigration to meet labour demands.

item.title: Canada Takes Lead in Resettling Rohingya Refugees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: For a group of people living in refugee camps in Southern Bangladesh, the late arrival of the Canadian spring will mean a true fresh start in the spirit of the season. Canada is taking the initiative of opening its doors to a first group of Rohingya refugees living in UN camps in the southern tip of Bangladesh.

item.title: Canada's future directly linked to how well the federal immigration file is managed
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada's labour crunch has it facing one of the most seriousshortages of skilled workers in the industrial world. It's no secret that the Canadian government is working especially hard to attract an immigrant workforce to supplement its aging homegrown labour pool, precariously low birth rate, and booming economy. In fact, Canada welcomes more immigrants per capita than any other immigrant-receiving nation.

item.title: Canada Sets its Eyes on Surplus of British Doctors
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: With England expecting a surplus of talent in the medical profession in the coming years, Canada is eager to attract doctors to fill shortages being faced throughout the country.

item.title: Statistics Canada reports unemployment rate hits 32-year low
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The unemployment rate fell to 6.3 percent in March, the lowest it's been in decades. The number of jobs in Canada has increased by a whopping 330,000 (2.1 percent) during the last year, an amazing growth by anyone's measure.

item.title: Canada Must Fight To Attract Global Talent
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Gordon Nixon, the president and chief executive of The Royal Bank of Canada says that Alberta and the rest of Canada need to increase the number of immigrants coming into the country and take advantage of the skills they bring with them.

item.title: Canada May Reconsider Dual Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After 30 years the rules currently in place that allow individuals who live outside of Canada to hold dual Canadian citizenship are about to be revisited by the Canadian government. This is to be done after the government began calculating the cost of the recent mass evacuation of civilians in Lebanon who held Canadian citizenship during the recent conflict between Hezbollah and Israel.

item.title: Canadian Government to Attract More Skilled Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
THE TORONTO STAR

Feb. 19, 2003

OTTAWA -- The government will spend $41.4 million over the next two years to attract more skilled workers and foreign students to Canada and to helpworkers find jobs once they get here.

item.title: Canada's Construction Industry Calls for Greater Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The construction industry in Canada is hungry for more workers, and they are happy to hire new immigrants, according to a recent survey. With potential growth being held back by labour shortages, industry leaders are calling on the government to increase immigration and to improve recruiting strategies to bring individuals with much-needed construction skills to Canada.

item.title: Canada celebrates evolving cultural mosaic on Canada Day
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Today marks the 142nd anniversary of the official establishment of Canada, the day the British North American provinces were united in the federation ofCanada . Commonly known as Canada Day, July 1st is celebrated across Canada through various events.

item.title: Canada Celebrates 60 Years of Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Today, the Honorable Diane Finley, Minister Citizenship and Immigration Canada held a commemorative citizenship ceremony to celebrate the 60th anniversary of Canadian citizenship at the Supreme Court of Canada.

item.title: Canada Celebrates 25th Anniversary of Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: This week Canada marks the 25th anniversary of a defining moment in its history. It was at this time in 1982 that the Canadian constitution was repatriated and the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms came into effect.

item.title: Canada's Atlantic Provinces Discussing Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada's Citizenship and Immigration Minister, Monte Solberg, met this week with the country's four Atlantic Provinces to explore new ways of working together in a bid to increase the number of Newcomers that settle east of Ontario.

item.title: Canada - A Good Influence on the World
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A recent poll ranks Canada as the country with the most positive influence in the world. 28,000 people in 27 countries were asked to rate 12 countries as either having a positive or negative worldwide influence. Canada’s overall influence rating topped the list with 54 per cent of respondents rating it mostly positive and only 14 per cent mostly negative. Japan came in at a close second with an identical positive rating but a higher negative rating.

item.title: British Politician Hails Canada as a Model for Multiculturalism
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In a speech delivered at the University of Oxford last week, the British House of Commons leader Jack Straw pointed to Canada as a model for multiculturalism and civic cohesion. Straw suggested that the United Kingdom could learn a great deal from the Canadian experience.

item.title: British Columbia Tourism Seeking Workers from the Philippines
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The British Columbia and Yukon Hotel Association (BCYHA) is actively recruiting Filipino workers through Canadian recruitment agencies. Of its 580 member organizations, 79 per cent will be hiring this year. Given that many BCYHA members have spent thousands of dollars this year on unsuccessful attempts at hiring Canadians, the bulk of their new employees will likely be foreign workers.

item.title: British Columbia Human-Rights Tribunal to Weigh in on Mall Dispute
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Former tenants are bringing complaints of racial discrimination against H-Mart, a large Korean grocery store chain, in connection with a mall in Langley, B.C., a suburb of Vancouver. Three small business owners are alleging that H-mart, who recently purchased the West Willow mall, refused to renew their leases because they were not Korean.

item.title: British Columbia construction industry fast-tracks skilled trades workers from Europe
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: European employees are hired in association with the Provincial Nominee Program (PNP), which effectively speeds up an immigrant's work permit and landed immigrant application processing.

item.title: Almost anyone born in Canada is a Canadian citizen - Even those born in Canadian airspace!
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On New Year's Eve, a baby was born on an international flight as the plane flew over Canada. When the Ugandan mother and her baby landed in Boston, American officials deemed the baby a Canadian citizen to speed their passage through customs.

item.title: 'Welcome BC' Initiative Allocates $43 million to Immigrant Settlement and Multiculturalism Services
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Forty-three million dollars over two years has been earmarked by the British Columbia (BC) provincial government to help immigrants find work in their fields and better integrate into their new communities. From improved English language training programs to employment, education, health and recreation services, ‘Welcome BC’ aims to ensure that the province remains an attractive destination for new immigrants.

item.title: Auditor General requests review of Passport, Citizenship and Immigration service fees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: According to Canada's auditor general, Sheila Fraser, Canada's Foreign Affairs department is collecting more than it should from Canadian passport applicants. She announced that the $25 consular service fee (which is lumped into the $85 cost of an adult passport) is more than the department should be charging, given the services that passport holder receives in return.

item.title: Atlantic Provinces working together to build regional immigration strategy
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Along with the federal government, the provincial governments of Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island, and Newfoundland and Labrador have agreed to work together through the Atlantic Canada Opportunities Agency to promote immigration to the region.

item.title: Atlantic Provinces contemplating a regional immigration policy
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Atlantic Canada’s (Prince Edward Island, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, and Newfoundland and Labrador) share of immigration in 2007 was 2.4 per cent, the highest it has been since 1980. Although immigrant attraction and retention rates have improved over the past few decades, the numbers are still low, considering that the region constitutes 7.1 per cent of Canada’s total population.

item.title: PM Offers Apology for Chinese Head Tax, Promises Funding Towards Cultural Community Programs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: PM apologizes for the Chinese head tax of the 19th and early 20th centuries, offering compensation packages of $20,000 to surviving payers of the tax and commits $35 million to cultural education programs in a recent speech.

item.title: Amendments to Canadian Citizenship Act for people born outside of Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: All individuals born in Canada are granted citizenship, as are people born abroad who undertake the Canadian citizenship process and are approved.

item.title: Alberta recruiting in India to fill provincial labour shortages
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Last month, a team of Alberta government and industry leaders went to India on a trade mission. Though the focus of the GO-India mission was meant to be trade and investment, it served just as much as a recruitment fair for labour-strapped Canadian employers.

item.title: Alberta has a new plan to help immigrants enter the workforce more quickly
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A Foreign Qualifications Recognition Plan for Alberta, recently released by the provincial government, will improve the process of recognizing internationally-obtained qualifications, training, and experience so that newcomers to Alberta can get to work faster.

item.title: Alberta Looking for Unskilled Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As Alberta's service and retail sectors are heating to a boil; the province is left scrambling to find unskilled labour.

item.title: Alberta's Labour Market Ranked No. 1 in North America
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A recent Fraser Institute survey named the province ofAlbertaas having North America's best-performing labour market over the past five years, beating out 50 American states and all other Canadian provinces andterritories.

item.title: Alberta is Canada's Leading Job Engine
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Alberta's unemployment rate fell again last month as the province created 13,600 jobs in July. Alberta's 3.3 percent unemployment rate was the lowest in the country for the 13th straight month, according to Alberta Employment, Immigration and Industry.

item.title: Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP) expands to family sponsorship

item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Strategic Recruitment Stream of the Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP) fast-tracks the permanent residency applications of migrants who have been working for at least one year in the United States on an H1B visa* in an occupation that is in high demand in Alberta. No Canadian job offer is required for this category.

item.title: Alberta Government Taking on Labour Shortages with Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Early next week, the Alberta government is expected to sign a special immigration deal with the federal government. As Canada’s fastest growing province, Alberta regards immigration as an important solution to its chronic labour shortages. With a job market growth rate outpacing all other provinces, Alberta currently has more jobs than they do people to fill them.

item.title: Alberta and British Columbia seeking Filipino skilled workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian province of Alberta has a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the Philippines’ Department of Labour and Employment (DOLE) regarding human resource development to promote the many employment opportunities in Alberta.

item.title: Alberta announces changes to its popular H1B fast-track immigration category
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of today, the Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP) has removed certain occupations from its list of qualifying occupations for the popular U.S. Visa Holder category. Eight Information Technology (IT) occupations are no longer listed as "occupations under pressure" in Alberta. Applicants with work experience in these occupations are no longer qualified for the program.

item.title: Afghan-Canadian Community Centre provides online education to Afghan women

In these essays, the applicants give their take on how immigration has shaped Canada, and outline their personal experiences and advice to others who are going through the same process.

item.title: Canadian Government Discusses Economic Immigration With Provincial Counterparts
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

item.title: Parent And Grandparent Super Visa Hits Major Milestone
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister, Chris Alexander, has announced that the 50,000thParent and Grandparent Super Visa has recently been issued, a major milestone for the popular program.

item.title: Three year Canada work permits now available to international students
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Making it easier for international students in Canada to obtain work permits upon graduation is a welcomed development, says Canadian immigration attorney David Cohen. Not only will it help Canada’s international student retention rate and ease current skills shortages, but it will also create a pool of qualified Canadian Permanent Residency applicants – applicants with Canadian education and work experience who have already integrated into Canadian society.

item.title: Canada Immigration Key to Sustaining the Canadian Population
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: With a dwindling national birthrate and baby boomers nearing the end of their lifespans towards 2030, Canada will soon be completely dependent on immigration to maintain population and economic growth. According to a Statistics Canada national census, immigration is currently responsible for two thirds of Canada's 5.4 percent growth.

item.title: Ontario's Pilot Provincial Nominee Program to Strengthen the Economy through Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Ontario has now joined every other provincial government in offering a provincial immigration program, designed to fast-track the issuance of Canadian Permanent Resident Visas for foreign workers with skills in demand.

item.title: New immigration category for temporary residents currently working in Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: They have Canadian work experience, they’ve settled into Canadian society, they are contributing to our economy; international graduates and temporary foreign workers are ideal candidates for immigration to Canada, says Canadian immigration Attorney David Cohen. Now, with their own category of immigration (the Canadian Experience Class) their Canadian education and/or work experience will give them an edge in their bid to become permanent residents and Canadian citizens.

item.title: New Immigration Agreement Between Canada and Alberta
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

item.description: As one of the most popular immigration provinces, it's about time that Ontario spruce up its Provincial Nominee Program (PNP), says Attorney David Cohen of the Cohen Immigration Law Canadian Immigration Law Firm. The Ontario Government has recently upgraded its Pilot PNP to the full-fledged Opportunities Ontario Provincial Nominee Program, giving it greater versatility as well as the ability to welcome more immigrants to Ontario.

item.title: Emerging Social Networking Site Facilitates Canadian Immigration and Settlement
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: LoonLounge's rapid member increase unveils burgeoning social movement - Although LoonLounge is only now being officially launched, the Canadian immigration online community has already made an impact. Nearly 15,000 members from 191 countries have registered, indicative of a social movement over the net. And it is not just immigrants benefiting from this social networking tool, established Canadians and recently-landed immigrants also find the site beneficial.

item.title: Canada Lifts Visa Ban For Ebola-Free Liberia
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After 42 days with no new cases of Ebola in Liberia, the West African country has been declared Ebola-free, leading Canada to lift a visa ban that was introduced in late October, 2014. This ban halted the processing of visa requests from those in countries experiencing widespread Ebola infections, including Sierra Leone, Guinea and Liberia.

item.title: Canadian Experience Class now open for Canadian immigration applicants

item.description: As of September 17, 2008, Citizenship and Immigration Canada is accepting applications for the newest category of Canadian immigration, the Canadian Experience Class. This fast-track option for temporary foreign workers and international graduates is a good news story in the Canadian immigration arena, says Canadian immigration lawyer David Cohen. These temporary residents can now more easily transition to Permanent Residents and, eventually Canadian citizens.

item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
On November 29, 2008, Citizenship, Immigration and Multiculturalism Canada (CIMC) Minister Jason Kenney announced changes to the way Federal Skilled Worker applications will be processed.

The changes are in immediate effect and retroactively apply to all Federal Skilled Worker applications submitted on or after February 27, 2008.

item.title: Leading Canada Immigration Law Firm Announces Revamp of CanadaVisa.com
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
New CanadaVisa.com caters to speeding up the Canadian immigration application process.

The Law Firm of Cohen Immigration Law has launched a fresh version of their Canadian immigration website with a distinct and focused message: you can get to Canada sooner than you think. The new strategic direction of the site is inspired by feedback from clients, many of whom express concern about immigration waiting times. The new website provides visitors with tools and solutions to alleviate this concern.

item.title: American Refugee Policies Violate Canada-US Safe Third Country Agreement
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A Canadian Federal Court judge has ruled that Canada must reassess its reciprocal refugee-protection agreement with the United States, stating that the US is not in compliance with international refugee conventions. Attorney David Cohen comments on the implications for Canada immigration.

item.title: Philippines Becomes Top Source Country For New Canadian Permanent Residents
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: More than 40,000 permanent residents from the Philippines became permanent residents of Canada in 2014. That figure is up from 29,539 in 2013, making the Philippines the top source country for Canadian immigration last year. China had been the top source country in 2013.

item.title: Manitoba Reopens Skilled Worker Overseas Stream For Canadian Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of April 30, 2015, the Canadian province of Manitoba has reopened the Skilled Worker Overseas Stream of the Manitoba Provincial Nominee Program (MPNP). item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

The government of Saskatchewan, which had been seeking an increase in its Saskatchewan Immigrant Nominee Program (SINP) for Canadian immigration, has stated that the increased quota will help to alleviate labour market shortages. Saskatchewan currently has the lowest unemployment rate of all the Canadian provinces.

item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)

item.title: Canada Eliminates Visa Requirement For Chilean Tourists
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Chilean Minister of Foreign Affairs, Heraldo Muñoz, has announced that Chilean citizens wishing to visit Canada as tourists or in transit to a third country will no longer require visas. Citizens of Chile will only require a passport in order to enter Canada.

item.description: The number of international students choosing to study in Canada at third-level education institutions has increased by 26 per cent since 2012, it has been revealed. 103,999 study permits were issued from January to September of 2014, an 11 per cent increase from the same period in 2013 (93,717) and a 26 per cent increase for the same period in 2012 (84,207).

item.description: A program that assists businesses in minority francophone communities outside Quebec hire temporary foreign workers is to close after September 30.

item.title: Government Of Canada Closes French Significant Benefit Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A program that assists businesses in minority francophone communities outside Quebec hire temporary foreign workers is to close after September 30.

item.title: Immigration Will Have Large Effect On Population Changes, Says Statistics Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Statistics Canada, the federal agency assigned to produce statistics to better understand Canada, has released its latest population projections. It is projected that immigration will heavily influence the makeup of the country over the coming decades.

item.title: Temporary Foreign Worker Applications Fall By 74%
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The month of August, 2014 saw a drop by nearly three quarters on the same month in 2012 in the number of applications made to hire temporary foreign workers.

item.title: Temporary Foreign Worker Applications Fall By 74%
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The month of August, 2014 saw a drop by nearly three quarters on the same month in 2012 in the number of applications made to hire temporary foreign workers.

item.title: British Columbia Government Not Convinced By Proposed Changes To Birthright Provision
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of British Columbia has joined its counterpart in Ontario in questioning the federal government’s proposed crackdown on “birth tourism” , whereby female foreign nationals enter Canada in order to give birth on Canadian soil in order for their offspring to automatically attain Canadian citizenship.

item.title: Government Of Canada To Provide Details Of Nova Scotia PNP This Fall
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Costas Menegakis, the parliamentary secretary to Immigration Minister Chris Alexander, has stated that any change in the allocation provided for the Nova Scotia Provincial Nominee Program (PNP) will be announced this fall.

item.title: Immigration Minister Promotes Francophone Immigration To Communities Outside Quebec
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In a series of meetings with community leaders, immigration advocacy groups, and stakeholders in Winnipeg this week, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Chris Alexander, has advocated increased francophone immigration across Canada.

item.title: Immigration Minister Promotes Francophone Immigration To Communities Outside Quebec
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In a series of meetings with community leaders, immigration advocacy groups, and stakeholders in Winnipeg this week, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Chris Alexander, has advocated increased francophone immigration across Canada.

item.title: Immigration Minister Addresses Thunder Bay Chamber Of Commerce
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The federal Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Chris Alexander, addressed the Thunder Bay Chamber of Commerce at Lakehead University on Monday, September 8, discussing the issue of immigration.

item.title: Alberta Pilot Program For Specific Occupations Not Renewed By Federal Government
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada has allowed the Alberta Pilot Program for occupation-specific work permits, which allowed employers in certain to hire from overseas without the need for a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA), to lapse.

item.title: Alberta Pilot Program For Specific Occupations Not Renewed By Federal Government
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada has allowed the Alberta Pilot Program for occupation-specific work permits, which allowed employers in certain to hire from overseas without the need for a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA), to lapse.

item.title: Governments Of Yukon And Canada Give Details Of Canada Job Grant
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The full agreement for the Canada Job Fund, which includes the creation of the Canada Job Grant, was announced today, September 8. The grant provides $500 million of federal funds to the provinces on a per capita basis. As such, Yukon will receive $1 million for investments in skills training, plus an additional $500,000 to recognise the distinct labour market needs of the territory.

item.title: Most Canadians Don’t Know How Many Immigrants Enter Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: An annual tracking survey by Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has found that the majority of adult Canadians don’t know how many landed immigrants are admitted by Canada every year.

item.title: Ontario Government Sceptical Of Proposed Changes To Birthright Provision
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The government of Ontario has said that it would not support any effort by the federal government to end Canada's jus soli provision, whereby children born in Canada automatically attain Canadian citizenship. A 2013 report, obtained under an access to information request and marked “secret”, revealed that the federal government has been considering revising this provision for some time.

item.title: Quebec Announces Changes To Investor Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Quebec has announced new rules regarding applications for a Certificat de sélection du Québec submitted under the province’s Investor Program. The announcement was made by the provincial government’s immigration ministry on August 27 in a Gazette Officielle du Québec.

item.title: Immigration Minister Grants Filipino Nanny Reprieve After Deportation Order
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A live-in caregiver facing deportation for “working without authorisation” has been granted the right to remain in Canada while her immigration application is in progress.

item.title: Trudeau Advises Ottawa To Work With Provinces On Foreign Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Liberal Party leader Justin Trudeau has urged the federal government to work more closely with provinces on immigration matters, in particular how the government oversees the temporary foreign worker program.

item.title: Canada Welcomes 150,000th New Citizen of 2014
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Chris Alexander, announced that Canada has welcomed its 150,000 new citizen of 2014. This is around double the number compared with the same period last year.

item.title: Minister Vows Speedier Start-up Visa Application Process
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Having seen just two completed applications in the Start-up Visa Program, a pilot program brought into being in early 2013, Canada’s Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Chris Alexander, has promised to speed up the process.
