item.title: Canadian Prime Minister Highlights Importance of Indian Immigrants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Prime Minister Stephen Harper delivered a keynote speech in Toronto at the Pearson Convention Centre on Thursday. During his speech, Mr. Harper emphasized that India has become the prime source country for immigration to Canada due to recent changes made by the Canadian government to facilitate immigration from India to Canada.

item.title: Students in Canada positive about job prospects
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Students in Canada are feeling increasingly confident about their career prospects once they enter the Canadian workforce. A survey by Environics Research Group found that 77 percent of students are optimistic about finding and enjoying work in their field, and more than half expect to be able to pay back students loans without difficulty.

item.title: Quebec Skilled Worker Cap Filled
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Quebec Skilled Worker Program has reached the maximum number of applications it will accept this year. The program, which was re-opened on April 1, 2014, had placed a cap of 6,500 on application intake.

item.title: Canadian Average Wage up Nearly 8%
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The wealth of Canadians has shown a promising increase, with their average net worth up nearly eight percent on higher real estate and investment values.

item.title: U.S. Immigration Issues Good for Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: During a visit to Vancouver this past Wednesday, Federal Employment Minister Jason Kenney highlighted Canada’s opportunity to take advantage of the current state of the United States’ immigration system by attracting young foreign nationals from the tech sector.

item.title: Canada and Lebanon Strengthen Ties
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Jason Kenney, the Canadian Minister of Employment and Social Development and Minister for Multiculturalism, recently returned from a visit to the country of Lebanon. While there, the Minister discussed the deepening of economic relations and reaffirmed Canada’s commitment to supporting the country’s ongoing efforts to address the Syrian refugee crisis.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Minister Welcomes First Successful Start-Up Visa Applicants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander welcomed the first two successful applicants under Canada’s Start-Up Visa Program on July 16 in Vancouver. The program is designed to attract more entrepreneurs to the country and create jobs for Canadians.

item.title: Manitoba Provincial Nominee Program to Briefly Pause Intake of Certain Applications
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Starting August 1, 2014, the Manitoba Provincial Nominee Program (MB PNP) will be transitioning to a new application management strategy. According to the program’s website, this strategy will reduce processing times to less than six months.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Minister Details Express Entry System
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander met with business leaders and stakeholders in Toronto yesterday about the January 2015 launch of the Express Entry electronic application management system. The system will serve as a faster and more economic way for skilled immigrants to come to Canada.

item.title: More than 1 Million Canadians have Roots in India
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander recently returned from a two-day trip to India. While there, he discussed a range of immigration initiatives that will benefit Indians coming to Canada for a variety of purposes.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Minister Announces CAN+ Program in India
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced the launch of the CAN+ program in India yesterday during a visit to New Delhi. The program aims to increase processing efficiency for visitors coming to Canada from India.

item.title: Some Pending Low-Wage LMIA Applications to be Returned
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of June 20 2014, the Government of Canada will no longer process any applications submitted on or before that date for low-wage positions to the Temporary Foreign Worker Program.

item.title: Canada Welcomes Over 2,200 New Citizens on Canada Day
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On July 1, 2014, Canada’s 147th birthday, more than 2,200 new Canadians from 138 countries were welcomed to the country at 45 citizenship ceremonies across the nation.

item.title: Canada Celebrates Canada Day
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: July 1, 2014 is Canada Day, Canada’s 147th birthday. To celebrate, many proud Canadians are participating in festivities in cities and regions across the nation.

item.title: Work Permit Fee Eliminated for Musicians Playing in Bars and Restaurants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Foreign artists entering Canada to perform in a bar or restaurant can now do so without the need to apply for and receive a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA). Previously, an LMIA, as well as the associated fee of $275 per individual, was needed for artists performing in this capacity.

item.title: Canadians Celebrate Heritage This Week
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadians are celebrating their shared heritage throughout June and early July. From June 21 to July 1, 2014, events are being held across the country to commemorate Canada’s history, diversity, and national identity.

item.title: Canada’s Biotechnology Industry on the Rise
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Parliamentary Secretary to the Ministry of Industry Mike Lake took part in the 2014 BIO International Convention in San Diego. The annual convention is the world’s largest gathering of scientific leaders and representatives from biotechnology and pharmaceutical firms, with representatives from 80 Canadian companies.

item.title: Government Announces Final Passage of Bill C-24
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced yesterday that reforms to the Citizenship Act have received final passage and Royal Assent. These reforms are the first major changes to the program since 1977. The changes will affect the application process for immigration to Canada, and enforce new rules for some Canadian citizens.

item.title: Multicultural Society Helps Canadian Immigrants, Foreign Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Vancouver Island Multicultural Society is celebrating its 35th anniversary this year, and its leaders are looking back on the growth and successes of the organization.

item.title: Canada Wages On Par With U.S.
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: An internal government study has shown that wage levels in Canada are generally even with those in the United States, suggesting that Canadian workers should not be paid at a competitive disadvantage.

item.title: Diversity on the Rise in Canada’s Capital
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: An increasing number of businesses and public sector organizations in Ottawa have reflected the diversity of their respective communities by hiring new Canadian immigrants.

item.title: Nova Scotia Nominee Program Facilitates Immigration for International Graduates
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: International students who have graduated from a Canadian college or university now have the opportunity to easily settle in Nova Scotia after their studies are completed.

item.title: Changes to Assessment Criteria for Intra-Company Transferees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizen and Immigration Canada released a bulletin today outlining the changes made to the assessment criteria for work permit applications for intra-company transferees (ICTs).

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Announces Number of Applications to Federal Skilled Worker Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On June 6, 2014, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced the total number of applications received for the Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP). Since the program reopened on May 1, 157 applications have been received toward the overall cap of 25,000.

item.title: Elimination of Recruitment and Advertisement Exemption for International Students Graduating from Canadian Post-Secondary Institutions
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Employment and Social Development Canada has eliminated the Recruitment and Advertisement Exemption for international students who have graduated from recognized Canadian post-secondary institutions, and whose Post-Graduate Work Permits (PGWPs) are expiring.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Funds Literacy Program for New Canadian Families
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Home Instruction for Parents of Preschool Youngsters, a new program designed to help immigrant mothers prepare their children for kindergarten, has launched in Nanaimo, BC.

item.title: Immigration Minister Highlights Success of Canadian Citizenship Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Last Friday, May 30th, Canadian Citizen and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced that Canada had welcomed its 100,000th new citizen of 2014. Already in 2014, Canada has sworn in more than twice the number of new citizens than the number of new citizens admitted by this time in 2013.

item.title: Quebec Skilled Worker Cap Beginning to Fill
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Quebec has released new data on the number of applications received under the current Quebec Skilled Worker (QSW) program intake cycle. As of May 16, 2014, the program has received 2,173 applications. A maximum of 6,500 applications will be accepted in total.

item.title: New Immigrant Investor Program in the Works
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Last Friday, May 23, Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander met with business leaders to begin formulating plans for a new federal immigrant investor program. The program will be known as the Immigrant Investor Venture Capital pilot.

item.title: Need for Immigrants in Halifax
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A recent report has shown that immigration to Nova Scotia hit an eight year low in 2013, with outmigration to other parts of Canada at the highest level in over a decade.

item.title: AB Leaders Seek to Help Foreign Workers Transition to Permanent Residency
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Alberta jobs minister Thomas Lukaszuk and Gil McGowan, a labour leader with the Alberta Federation of Labour, found common ground at a forum on temporary foreign workers in Edmonton. The two leaders say they want to see a system in place that allows temporary foreign workers to become permanent residents.

item.title: Permanent Labour Market Opinions to Replace Arranged Employment Opinions
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective May 4, 2014, employers wishing to hire a foreign worker on a full-time, permanent basis must apply for and receive a positive Labour Market Opinion (LMO) instead of an Arranged Employment Opinion (AEO).

item.title: Quebec Seeks Exemption to Foreign Worker Moratorium
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Quebec’s Immigration Minister, Kathleen Weil, has gone on record stating that the province will seek an exemption from a recent moratorium placed on hiring foreign food service workers.

item.title: Canada Eases Entry Requirements for Mexican Visitors
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced today that Canada is taking action to make it “faster and easier” for Mexican visitors to enter the country. This will be done by making a pilot program, called CAN+, a permanent fixture of Canada’s immigration system.

item.title: Canada is 5th Happiest Country in the World
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
A new quality of life report, called the “Better Life Index”, has ranked Canada as the fifth happiest place in the world.

“Canada performs very well in many measures of well-being, as shown by the fact that it ranks among the top countries in a large number of topics,” read the report.

item.title: Five Country Conference on Migration and Security Hosted in Quebec City
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Leaders from Canada, the US, the UK, Australia, and New Zealand are meeting in Quebec City this week to discuss collective immigration and border management issues.

item.title: Regional Labour Market Demand Stream is Closed
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Nova Scotia announced today that the Regional Labour Market Demand Stream is now closed and will no longer be accepting any applications that are not received in the office and/or postmarked by April 28, 2014. The stream will re-open on January 1, 2015.

item.title: Specific Occupations Affected by LMO Moratorium Announced
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Employment and Social Development Minister Jason Kenney recently announced that some occupations in the food services industry would no longer be eligible for Labour Market Opinions (LMOs). Receiving an LMO is an important first step for securing many temporary work permit applications.

item.title: Moratorium on Temporary Work Permits for Food Services Sector
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective immediately, Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) will no longer process any new or pending Labour Market Opinions for applications related to work in the food services sector. In addition, any unfilled positions that are tied to a previously approved LMO will be suspended.

item.title: 2013 Saw Record Number of Visitors, Immigrants from China, India and Philippines
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Last year broke several records for visitors and immigrants from the three largest source countries for newcomers to Canada. Every year tens of thousands of individuals from China, India, and the Philippines become permanent residents of Canada. Hundreds of thousands more travel to the country to visit,

item.title: Canada a Destination for Venture Capitalists
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian provinces of Ontario, Quebec, and British Columbia are three of the most popular locations in North America for venture capital investment.

item.title: Canada’s New Immigration Model Will be Called Express Entry
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced earlier this week that Canada's new recruitment model for economic immigration will be called "Express Entry". This new model is set to launch in January 2015.

item.title: Changes to CELPIP Language Test
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of April 1, 2014, the CELPIP-G test will no longer be used as a test to prove English language proficiency. It will be replaced by the "CELPIP-General (CELPIP-G 2014)" test. After April 1, 2014, individuals wishing to use CELPIP results to prove English language proficiency must submit scores from a CELPIP-G 2014 test.

item.title: Canada Ranks High for Social Progress
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada is the most socially progressive country in the Western Hemisphere, and the seventh most progressive overall, according to a recent study. The study, which was created by the US-based group Social Progress Imperative, measured a number of factors to rank countries by the wellbeing of their residents.

item.title: Quebec Announces New Caps
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
The Government of Quebec has announced a number of measures for its Skilled Worker, Investor, and Entrepreneur programs. They are as follows:

Skilled Worker – Between April 1, 2014 and March 31, 2015, a maximum of 6,500 applications will be accepted for review by the Quebec Skilled Worker Program.

item.title: Immigration Minister Hints at New Immigrant Investor Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, Chris Alexander, visited Hong Kong and mainland China last week. During his time there, he spoke with the South China Morning Post newspaper about the future of the Federal Immigrant Investor Program.

item.title: More Information Released on Nova Scotia Regional Labour Market Demand Stream
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Nova Scotia Office of Immigration has released further details on its newest immigration stream, called the Regional Labour Market Demand Stream. This stream, which began considering applications on March 6, 2014, has gained attention because applicants do not need a Canadian job offer in order to be eligible.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Minister Visits China
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Chris Alexander, the Canadian Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, is currently traveling to Hong Kong and Shanghai. During his trip, he will be promoting options for Chinese businesses, travellers, and students in Canada.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Encourages Use of Authorized Representatives
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On Thursday, March 13, 2014 Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) issued a statement encouraging prospective immigration application to use authorized immigration representatives. This statement was issued as part of Fraud Prevention Month, which has been ongoing during the month of March.

item.title: Alberta Creates More Than 85% of Canadian Jobs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new report from Statistics Canada showed that, in the past year, Alberta was responsible for 87 percent of new jobs created in Canada in the past year. In the past 12 months, a full 82,000 jobs were created, out of a national total of approximately 95,000.

item.title: Canada One of Best Places in the World to Retire
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada is the number 14 country in which to retire, roundly beating the United States. According to the Global Retirement Index, released by Natixis Global Asset Management, Canada is one of just six non-European countries to make the list of 20 nations. At number 19, the US barely made the list.

item.title: Nova Scotia Introduces New Immigration Stream
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of March 6, 2014, the province of Nova Scotia will be making important changes to the Nova Scotia Provincial Nominee Program (NS PNP).

item.title: Almost 20,000 New Canadians Received Citizenship in February
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A total of 19,200 individuals from 193 countries became Canadian citizens last month. This number is almost double that for last February, when a little fewer than 10,000 people were granted Canadian citizenship.

item.title: Children of Immigrants Succeed in Canadian Universities
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: According to a study by Statistics Canada, children of immigrants to Canada are almost twice as likely to attend university as students whose parents were born in the country.

item.title: Major Changes to Temporary Foreign Worker Program Announced
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Employment Minister Jason Kenney and Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced major reforms to Canada’s Temporary Foreign Worker Program this afternoon.

item.title: Quebec May Adopt ‘Expression of Interest’ Immigration Model
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Quebec’s Immigration Minister, Diane De Courcy, has presented a plan to bring the province’s skilled worker program in line with proposed federal immigration changes.

item.title: Canada, US, and Mexico to Discuss NAFTA Rules for Business Travelers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Leaders from Canada, the US, and Mexico will be meeting on Wednesday, February 19, 2014 to mark the 20th anniversary of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA). During this meeting, all three countries will be holding talks to discuss further integrating their commercial ties.

item.title: New Regulations for International Students to Take Force June 1
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
A number of new regulations for study permits and other international student programs were announced today, February 12. These regulations will come into force on June 1, 2014.

The following chart provides a summary of the changes, as stated by Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC):

item.title: Major Changes to Canadian Citizenship Act Announced Today
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander today revealed plans for comprehensive reforms to the Canadian Citizenship Act. These are the first major reforms to take place since 1977. The changes are part of Bill C-24, which has yet to be passed by Canadian Parliament.

item.title: January 2014 Saw Double the Number of Canadian Citizenship Issuances
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: This past January, a total of 16,000 immigrants officially became Canadian citizens. This is fully twice as many as in January 2013, where only 8,250 people obtained citizenship.

item.title: Visitors to Canada will be Automatically Considered for Multiple-Entry Visas
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced yesterday that visitors to Canada will now be automatically considered for a multiple-entry visa. This new policy will come into force this Thursday, February 6, 2013. In addition, the fee for a Temporary Resident Visa (TRV) will be decreased from $150 to $100, regardless of whether the visa issued is a single- or multiple-entry visa.

item.title: Parent and Grandparent Sponsorship Cap Filled
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After only a month, the Parent and Grandparent sponsorship program has reached the maximum number of applications that will be accepted this year. The program, which re-opened on January 2, 2014, had placed a cap of 5,000 on application intake.

item.title: New Temporary Foreign Worker Rules may Reduce Processing Times
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: According to the Globe and Mail newspaper, the Canadian government is preparing to enact new changes to the country’s Temporary Foreign Worker Program (TFWP).

item.title: Canada Seeks to Double Number of International Students by 2022
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: According to a new plan released this week, the Canadian government hopes to attract 450,000 international students by 2022. This is double the current number of international students currently studying in the country.

item.title: Calgary is a Must-See City for 2014
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The city of Calgary, in the Canadian province of Alberta, has made the New York Times’ list of must-see destinations for 2014.

item.title: SINP Intake Quotas Slowly Filling
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of January 10, 2014, the Saskatchewan intake cap for international skilled workers without a job offer has been filled. The cap, set at 250, is the first to fill in the popular Saskatchewan Immigrant Nominee Program (SINP).

item.title: High Numbers of Visas Issued to Indian Nationals
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Between January and December 2013, high numbers of visitor visas and study permits were issued by Canada’s visa offices in New Delhi and Chandigarh, India. A total of 84,672 visitor visas and 13,613 study permits were issued during this time frame.

item.title: Canada Pledges Funds to Combat Polio in Pakistan
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On Tuesday, January 7, the Government of Canada announced that it would donate $20 million over the next three years to support efforts to eradicate polio in Pakistan.

item.title: Information Technology Sector Booming in Ottawa
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada’s capitol city may be poised to become a major hub of information technology careers.

item.title: Parent and Grandparent Sponsorship Program Reopens Today
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The parent and grandparent sponsorship program, which previously saw a moratorium on application intake, began accepting applications once more on January 2, 2014.

item.title: Changes to Labour Market Opinion Process - Effective Dec. 31
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Four changes to the Labour Market Opinion (LMO) application process will come into effect on Tuesday, December 31. They are as follows:

item.title: New York Visa Application Center Has Been Closed
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian visa application center (VAC) in New York City has been closed until further notice. Applications that have already been received by the VAC will continue to be processed.

item.title: Improvement to Canadian Passport Services
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced yesterday that Canadians living abroad will receive improved passport services. These improvements are effective as of December 9, 2013.

item.title: Canadian Leaders Reflect on Nelson Mandela’s Legacy
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadians across the country joined South Africans in mourning the passing of Nelson Mandela, and celebrating the former president’s legacy. Mr. Mandela was the first black South African president, and is known worldwide for his leadership in the struggle against apartheid.

item.title: Canada has Highest Rate of Job Satisfaction Levels
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadians are the most happy with their jobs, according to a recent study. The study reported that approximately two thirds, of 64 percent, of Canadians said that they loved their job or ‘like it a lot’. A full 24 percent of Canadians love their jobs so much that they said they would even work for free.

item.title: Ontario Expands Programming for Immigrants throughout Province
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The province of Ontario, in partnership with the Federal Government, is expanding the successful Ontario Bridge Training Program. The program to date has helped over 50,000 immigrants become licensed in Canada and find jobs in their fields.

item.title: Entrepreneur Start-Up Program Prepares to Issue First Visas
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa Program is close to issuing its first visas to applicants.

item.title: Priority Immigration Processing for Individuals Affected by Typhoon Haiyan
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced today that it will offer priority processing of immigration applications from individuals who have been ‘significantly affected’ by Typhoon Haiyan.

item.title: Visa Requirements Lifted for Czech Republic Nationals
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective immediately, Czech passport holders no longer require a Temporary Resident Visa (TRV) to travel to Canada.

item.title: Canada Pledges Aid to Philippines in Wake of Typhoon Haiyan
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In the aftermath of the devastating typhoon that ripped through the Philippines last week, the Government of Canada has created the Philippines Crisis Fund to assist in relief and recovery efforts. Already, the government has pledged $5 million in support to humanitarian organizations working in the country. It has also pledged to match donations made by individual Canadians to registered Canadian charities.

item.title: Intake Caps Announced for Canadian Experience Class in 2014
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian Experience Class (CEC) will be introducing a cap on application intake. From November 9, 2013 to October 31, 2014, a maximum of 12,000 applications will be accepted for review.

item.title: Canada’s French Heritage Celebrated During Francophone Immigration Week
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: This week, Canada’s French-speaking communities take the spotlight as the country celebrates Semaine de l’immigration francophone / Francophone Immigration Week. This is the first time such a week has been celebrated nationwide.

item.title: Canada’s Foreign Worker Intake on the Rise
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has released preliminary estimates of the country’s temporary foreign worker intake for 2013. According to its figures, the country has significantly raised its admissions this year.

item.title: Permanent Residency for Parents and Grandparents, Live-In Caregivers to Increase in 2014
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada has released some of its plans for immigration levels in 2014. Included in these plans are expected increases in the number of permanent residency visas issued to applicants through the Live-In Caregiver and Parent and Grandparent programs.

item.title: Canadian Citizenship Week Celebrates Canada’s Unique Heritage
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: This week, from October 21 to 27, is Canadian citizenship week! To celebrate the importance of Canadian citizenship, a range of activities are being held throughout the country.

item.title: Canada and European Union Reach Landmark Trade Agreement
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper announced on Friday, October 18, that Canada and the European Union (EU) will soon be signing a sweeping trade agreement. The agreement, which will greatly enhance trade and investment ties between the two partners, will be the largest that Canada has ever signed.

item.title: Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa Program adds Business Incubator Stream
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Minister Chris Alexander announced today that the popular Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa Program will add a new stream to link foreign entrepreneurs with business incubators in Canada. The stream is scheduled to begin accepting applications on October 26, 2013.

item.title: Malala Yousafzai Offered Honorary Canadian Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian authorities have confirmed that Malala Yousafzai, a 16-year-old advocate for girl’s education in Pakistan and worldwide, will be made an honorary Canadian citizen.

item.title: Canada and US Will Share Information to Fight Foreign Criminals
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada and the United States will be implementing a new information-sharing system aimed at decreasing the number of foreign criminals and ineligible refugee claimants to both countries. The plan, which is to be fully implemented by next fall, will include the sharing of basic information such as an individual’s date of birth, travel documentation and fingerprints.

item.title: Workers in US Should be Tapped to Fill Canada’s Labour Shortage, Study Shows
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new study by the Conference Board of Canada, released on Friday, suggests that Canadian employers should look south of their own border to find the workers needed to fill shortages across the country.

item.title: Foreign Service Workers, Canadian Government Strike Tentative Deal
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A lengthy dispute between some Canadian Foreign Service officials and the Canadian government has finally ended, thanks to a possible new deal between the two parties. With this deal comes the end of rotating strikes at visa offices across the world, which had allegedly slowed processing of visitor and study visa applications.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Officer among Those Killed in Nairobi Attack
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Annemarie Desloges, a Canadian consular officer, was one of two Canadians killed in last Saturday’s terrorist attack in Nairobi.

item.title: Changes Made to Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On Friday, September 13, the province of Alberta announced several changes to its Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP). These changes will help to facilitate immigration for certain categories of workers intending to settle in the province.

item.title: Canadian Organization Asks Government for More Temporary Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian Federation of Independent Business (CFIB) asked Ottawa to take immediate steps to bring in more temporary foreign workers. The organization states that almost 290,000 full- and part-time jobs remain unfilled across the country.

item.title: More Than a Quarter of British Columbia's Population Was Born Abroad
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Statistics Canada has begun to release data drawn from its 2011 census. It comes as no surprise that Canada holds its place as one of the most diverse countries in the world. The province of British Columbia (BC) is no exception.

item.title: New Brunswick’s Temporary Pause for Business Applicants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Each year, New Brunswick welcomes several hundred immigrants through the New Brunswick Provincial Nomination Program (NBPNP). This program allows individuals who wish to live and work in New Brunswick to come to Canada based on a nomination by the province.

item.title: New Biometric Requirements Take Force
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of Wednesday, September 5, some temporary residents in Canada will have to provide biometric data in order to enter the country.

item.title: Student Visa Issuances not Hindered by Visa Officer Strike
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Despite an ongoing strike by some Canadian Foreign Service officers, Canada has issued more study permits than last year. According to Postmedia News, more than 45,000 visas were issued to students between May and July, the busiest time of year for these applications. Last year, only 39,600 visas were issued during the same time period.

item.title: Legal Action Challenges Quebec Immigration Changes
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Legal proceedings were initiated today by the law firms of Cohen Immigration Law (David Cohen) and Irving Mitchell Kalichman (Mathieu Bouchard) in an effort to prevent the government of the province of Quebec from applying new (amended) immigration regulations retroactively.

item.title: After Labour Dispute, BC Mine Welcomes Foreign Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Up to 30 new workers from China are expected to come to Canada to work for HD Mining company in British Columbia (BC). The company, whose decision to hire foreign workers came under scrutiny, intends to hire up to 201 Chinese workers.

item.title: Alleged Crime Boss to be Deported from Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The leader of the Shui Fong triad, which has been linked to murders and attacks during the 1990s, is set to be deported from Canada. Lai Tong Sang has lived in Canada for 17 years.

item.title: First Permanent Residents Come to Canada through Federal Skilled Trades Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Federal Skilled Trades Program, a new addition to Canada’s programs for permanent residency, recently welcomed its first successful applicants to the country.

item.title: Asylum Claims to Canada Lower by Over 50%
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada received half as many asylum claims in the first six months of 2013 than the same time span in 2012. This drop has been attributed to the government’s expedited processing rules for citizens of designated ‘safe’ countries.

item.title: International Post-Graduates Category now a permanent part of British Columbia PNP
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program (PNP) announced today that the International Post-Graduate (IPG) pilot project will become a permanent fixture in the province’s PNP program.

item.title: Extensive Changes made to Manitoba Provincial Nominee Program for Business
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Manitoba has announced a number of changes to the Manitoba Provincial Nominee Program for Business (PNP-B). These changes are effective immediately. They concern the following programs and procedures:

item.title: Changes to the Temporary Foreign Worker Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Earlier today, Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) announced important changes to the Temporary Foreign Worker Program that will come into effect immediately. According to HRSC, these changes are aimed at strengthening and improving the Temporary Foreign Worker Program.

item.title: Visitor Visas, Study Permits on Hold at 15 Visa Offices as Strike Continues
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Beginning Monday, 15 major Canadian visa offices will temporarily shut down visitor visa and study permit processing, as visa officers escalate a general strike.

item.title: Immigration from US to Canada at a Peak
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new study from the Association for Canadian Studies has revealed some surprising statistics. According to the study, more Americans than ever before are choosing to move north of their border, while the amount of Canadians moving to the US continues to drop.

item.title: Montreal is Top Destination for Chinese Students
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Montreal ranks first in the world for university experience, according to a recent poll conducted by China’s Bank of Communications and the Economist Intelligence Unit think tank.

item.title: Former Ambassador Named New Citizenship and Immigration Minister
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Chris Alexander, the former Canadian ambassador to Afghanistan, was appointed by Prime Minister Stephen Harper today as Canada’s new Minister of Citizenship, Immigration and Multiculturalism. He is taking over from Jason Kenney, who has held the position since 2008.

item.title: Quebec Announces New Immigration Rules
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
The government of Quebec announced today major changes to its immigration programs. These changes will become effective August 1, 2013.

Program changes have been broken down as follows:

item.title: Alberta Premier Wants More Temporary Workers to Help with Flood Rebuilding
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Alberta Premier Redford has stated that she plans to speak with Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper about bringing in more temporary workers to help with reconstruction in the wake of widespread flooding throughout the province.

item.title: Canada Announces Plans to Resettle Syrian Refugees
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada has pledged to resettle 1,300 Syrian refugees by the end of 2014, according to Immigration Minister Jason Kenney.

item.title: Two Announcements: Alberta Flooding, Canadian Embassy in Egypt
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
Special Measures for Residents Affected by Alberta Flooding

Temporary and permanent residents who have been affected by the flooding throughout Alberta will have application fees waived and statuses automatically extended, said Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC).

item.title: Canadians to be Consulted on Immigration Issues
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Last week, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced that it would be seeking input from Canadian citizens on immigration issues. The public is invited to fill out an online consultation, which will be open until August 31, 2013, on immigration levels and mix.

item.title: Today is Canadian Multiculturalism Day
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Today, across the country, Canadians are celebrating their multicultural heritage. Canadian Multiculturalism day was founded in 2002 by then-Prime Minister Jean Chretien, who designated June 27 of each year for the occasion.

item.title: Canada and U.S. Promote Cross-Border Business
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada and the U.S. have released their first progress report after announcing the creation of the Beyond the Border Action Plan in 2011. This joint plan between the two countries aims at facilitating the increase of trade and travel across their lengthy border, the longest in the world.

item.title: Immigrants Make up Half of Canada’s Millionaires
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new survey has revealed that almost half of Canada’s millionaires are either immigrants or first-generation Canadians.

item.title: Processing Times May Increase as Foreign Service Officers Strike
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Processing times for applications submitted to Canadian Visa Offices abroad may rise as Canada’s foreign service officers go on strike.

item.title: Canada Sees Largest Job Gains Since 2002
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada’s economy shocked even the most optimistic observers, as the month of May saw 95,000 new jobs created across the country. This is the largest gain since 2002, over a decade ago.

item.title: Changes to Alberta Semi-Skilled Worker Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP) has created a short-term initiative geared towards supporting businesses in the hotel and lodging industry throughout the province.

item.title: Citizenship Test-Takers Now Have Two Chances to Pass
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective immediately, applicants for Canadian citizenship who fail the citizenship test will now be granted a second opportunity to pass.

item.title: Bilingualism in Canada on the Decline, Immigration Cited as One Cause
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada may be an officially bilingual country. However, Statistics Canada has revealed that the amount of individuals able to speak both French and English is on the decline for the first time in 50 years.

item.title: Alberta Eases Requirements for Semi-Skilled Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Alberta Immigrant Nominee Program (AINP) has reduced work experience requirements in its Semi-Skilled Worker stream.

item.title: Canada Adds New ‘Safe’ Countries to List for Asylum Seekers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: In an effort to streamline its asylum system, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has added new countries to its list of Designated Countries of Origin (DCOs). As of May 31, 2013, there will be 37 countries on the DCO list.

item.title: Number of US Visitors to Canada is Increasing
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The number of US visitors to Canada appears to be on the rise, according to figures from Statistics Canada. The number of visitors increased by 3.2 percent in March 2013 to a total of 1.74 million. This included more than one million overnight trips.

item.title: Canadian Court Dismisses BC Temporary Worker Case
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Federal Court of Canada has dismissed a case centered on a British Columbia company’s hiring of 201 Chinese miners.

item.title: Canada Courts Silicon Valley Entrepreneurs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Immigration Minister Jason Kenney is visiting Silicon Valley to push the government’s newest business immigration program, the Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa.

item.title: Parent and Grandparent Sponsorship Program to Reopen in 2014
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has announced that the Parent and Grandparent sponsorship stream will re-open on January 2, 2014. At that time, the program’s processing time is expected to be cut in half.

item.title: Family Class Immigration Increased in 2012
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: 2012 saw a 15 percent increase in immigration through Family Class sponsorship, according to a recent announcement by Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC).

item.title: Foreign Born Canadians at Historical High
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Over 6.8 million Canadians were born outside of Canada, according to new information from Statistics Canada. This staggering figure means that 20.6 percent of the population, or one in five people, are foreign-born.

item.title: Ministerial Instructions Announced for Immigration Programs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has issued a number of Ministerial Instructions pertaining to a range of Canadian immigration programs. The Ministerial Instructions were published in the Canada Gazette, a government publication, on May 4, 2013.

item.title: Federal Skilled Worker Program Opens Saturday
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After a long wait, the Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP) will open its doors to applicants this Sunday, May 4. Excited applicants from around the world are already preparing their applications in advance of Saturday’s opening.

item.title: Aerospace Industry Set to Expand in Quebec
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Three major European aerospace companies have announced plans to establish a presence in Montreal. Together the Austrian, French, and German companies will create nearly 200 jobs in the next few years.

item.title: Canada Will Soon Need 250,000 New Construction Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada needs over 250,000 new construction workers between now and the year 2021, says a leading industry organization.

item.title: Over 300,000 Temporary Foreign Workers Currently in Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As of December 1, 2013, there were 338,189 temporary foreign workers in Canada. This number has increased significantly from 2005, when foreign workers numbered 140,668.

item.title: Controversy Stirs over RBC Foreign Worker Hires
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada’s largest bank has in recent weeks come under fire for allegedly replacing Canadian workers with foreign hires. The Royal Bank of Canada, commonly known as RBC, denies this assertion.

item.title: New Immigrant Guide Released by Citizenship & Immigration Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has released a revamped, updated immigration guide for new Canadian permanent residents. The handbook, called Welcome to Canada, is the official book given to help immigrants prepare for their move and navigate the first months in their new home.

item.title: Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa Launched April 1st
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has launched an exciting new pilot, the Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa program, on April 1, 2013. The program, which will connect promising foreign entrepreneurs to Canadian organizations that will assist in start-up operations, is the first of its kind in the world.

item.title: Canada’s Immigration Backlog Reduced by Forty Percent
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The backlog of permanent resident applications waiting to be processed by government officials has been reduced by 40 percent, according to Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC). CIC believes that this reduction will help to create an immigration system more responsive to the needs of applicants and Canada as a whole.

item.title: Quebec Extends Current Skilled Worker Criteria
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The government of Quebec announced today that it will extend the duration of the current Quebec Skilled Worker (QSW) program. The QSW program, initially scheduled to accept applications until March 31, 2013, will continue accepting applications until July 31, 2013.

item.title: Government Set to Reform Temporary Foreign Worker Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada has announced that it will be taking steps to reform the country’s temporary foreign worker program to ensure qualified Canadians are not passed up for jobs. This plan, announced in the 2013 budget this past Thursday, has outlined a number of new measures that will be taken to prioritize the hiring of Canadian citizens and permanent residents.

item.title: Americans Top List of Illegal Foreign Workers, CBSA Says
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian Border Services Agency (CBSA) found 54 Americans working without authorization in Canada last year, according to Global News agency. This number makes the US the largest source of illegal foreign labour, at least among individuals who were apprehended.

item.title: Poll Shows Canadians Favor Setting Immigration Levels
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A recent poll has confirmed that Canadians favor responsibility in immigration, including measures such as setting limits on intake of immigrants. When asked the question “should Canada accept all qualified immigrants who want to enter the country, or should we limit the number of immigrants allowed each year?” a majority voted for the latter. This majority was somewhat greater amongst respondents born in Canada (73 percent) than respondents born outside of Canada (58 percent).

item.title: Over 1,000 Super Visas Issued Monthly
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Since its launch in December 2011, the new Parent and Grandparent Super Visa program has seen great success. To date, over 15,000 Super Visas have been issued to qualifying applicants. This translates to over 1,000 new Super Visa issuances each month.

item.title: Canadian Immigration Reaches Historical High for Seventh Consecutive Year
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: 2012 saw Canada reach its highest sustained level of immigration in history, continuing a seven year trend.

item.title: Federal Skilled Worker Program Will Include Occupation List
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has officially announced that the new Federal Skilled Worker program will include a list of designated occupations.

item.title: Canadian Experience Class is Fastest-Growing Immigration Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian Experience Class (CEC) is Canada’s fastest growing immigration program, with over 9,353 visas issued in 2012. This exceeded the program’s yearly target of 7,000 by 34 percent.

item.title: 2012 Breaks Records for Student Visa Issuances
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada welcomed over 100,000 international students in 2012, the highest amount in the country’s history. The number was a 60 percent jump from intake levels in 2004.

item.title: Canada Issued Almost 1 Million Visitor Visas in 2012
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada issued a record number of visitor visas last year. With almost 1 million approved, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has seen visitor visa issuances increase almost 40 percent since 2004.

item.title: Detroit Visa Office to Close
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Visa Office at the Canadian Consulate in Detroit has been closed. Its services have now been transferred to the New York City and Los Angeles Visa Offices.

item.title: Refugee Claimants from 8 More Countries Will See Faster Processing
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The list of Designated Countries of Origin, which was introduced on December 15, 2012 as part of the Protecting Canada’s Immigration System Act, has been amended to include eight new countries.

item.title: Overseas Orientation Program Graduates 20,000 Permanent Residents
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian Immigrant Integration Program (CIIP), founded in 2010, recently celebrated the graduation of its 20,000th participant.

item.title: Quebec Amends List of Occupations for Facilitated Labour Market Opinion
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Quebec announced yesterday that its list of occupations for the Facilitated Labour Market Opinion (FLMO) program has been amended. The FLMO is a provincial program that allows employers wishing to hire a foreign worker in a targeted profession obtain a positive Labour Market Opinion (LMO) without needing to recruit in Canada.

item.title: Proposed Bill Could Strip Terrorists of Canadian Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Jason Kenney stated that his government would like the power to strip citizenship from Canadians who commit terrorism or acts of war. This statement was made one day after a dual Canadian and Lebanese citizen was indicated as a participant in a bus bombing in Bulgaria last year.

item.title: Vancouver to Become New Host of TED Talks
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian city of Vancouver, British Columbia, has been selected as the host of the popular TED Talk series. TED, which stands for “Technology, Entertainment, and Design” is where leaders and innovators are invited at events around the world to give ‘the most important talk of their lives’. In recent years it has become a global sensation, with over 1,200 spin-off talks given in cities across the world.

item.title: Processing Changes at Canadian Visa Offices in the United States
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective January 29, 2013, a number of changes have been made to Canadian visa offices in the United States. These changes have been made by Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) with the intent to better expedite the processing of applications for Canadian temporary and permanent residency.

item.title: Canada Launches “First of its Kind” Entrepreneur Start-Up Visa
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced today that it will launch a new program on April 1, 2013, aimed at bringing the world’s best and brightest entrepreneurs to Canada. According to CIC, the program will be the first of its kind in any country. Its unique partnership model is intended to “position [Canada] as a destination of choice for start-ups”.

item.title: Libyan Family Welcomed Home to Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A Libyan family, originally deported from Canada five years ago, will be allowed to return to Canada on humanitarian and compassionate grounds.

item.title: Canada to resettle up to 5,000 Iranian and Iraqi refugees by 2018
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has announced plans to resettle up to 5,000 Iranian and Iraqi refugees, presently in Turkey, by 2018. Citing "escalating violence in the region," Immigration Minister Jason Kenney outlined his government's intention to "help Turkey deal with this growing pressure." He also commended the government of Turkey "for keeping her borders open to those fleeing the ongoing conflict in the region."

item.title: Indians Receive Record Number of Canadian Visas
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada’s visa office in Chandigarh, India has reported a record number of visa issuances for 2012. The office, situated in the country’s Punjab region, processes a variety of applications including those for study and visitor visas.

item.title: Canadian Economy Creates over 40,000 New Jobs in December
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Canadian economy generated over 40,000 jobs in December 2012, according to the latest Labour Survey published by Statistics Canada. While a majority of these jobs were created in the province of Ontario (33,000), Manitoba (5,200), Saskatchewan (4,000), Newfoundland and Labrador (2,700), and Prince Edward Island (1,300) also recorded significant job increases.

item.title: CIC Proposes Changes to International Student Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has proposed changes to the International Student Program. These changes are intended to benefit students while taking steps to prevent and reduce fraud.

item.title: Certain Visitors to Canada Must Now Provide Biometric Data
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Beginning in 2013, the Canadian government will begin requesting biometric data from some temporary visitors to the country.

item.title: BREAKING NEWS: Federal Skilled Worker Program Will Reopen in May
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has announced that the new points system for the Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP) will take effect on May 4, 2013. At that time, the program will begin accepting applications to its Skilled Worker category.

item.title: Work Permit Restrictions Relaxed for Some Federal Applicants
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new rule change will allow some applicants for Canadian permanent residency to be considered for a ‘bridging open work permit’ if their current work permit is set to expire.

item.title: CIC to Launch New Federal Skilled Trades Program in January 2013
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Starting January 2, 2013, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) will begin accepting applications for a new Federal Skilled Trade program designed to facilitate the entry of overseas skilled tradespersons into the Canadian workforce. Aimed at addressing “serious labour shortages in some regions of the country”, the program will also aim to revamp an immigration system that “has not been open to these in-demand skill workers,” according to Citizenship, Immigration and Multiculturalism Minister Jason Kenney.

item.title: Canada Ranks High for Immigrant Integration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A recent study by the Migrant Integration Policy Index has ranked Canada as the third best country in the world for immigrant integration. The study, which analyzed conditions in 31 North American and European countries, saw Canada score 89/100 points to be ranked above all countries except Sweden and Portugal.

item.title: Canada to Introduce New Asylum System
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: On December 15, 2012, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) will be introducing a new asylum system designed to overcome the limitations and vulnerabilities of its predecessor.

item.title: Report Says Canada Should Boost Immigration Levels in 2014
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: An internal government review has revealed suggestions to begin raising Canada’s immigration targets beginning in 2014.

item.title: Immigrants Granted Permanent Residency Due to Computer Glitch
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Approximately 150 new Canadian permanent residents were allowed to stay in Canada even though their visas had been issued by mistake.

item.title: Federal and Provincial Governments Meet to Discuss Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Immigration ministers from both federal and provincial/territorial governments met in Ottawa to discuss immigration matters.

item.title: Nova Scotia Increases its Provincial Nominee Quota
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Federal government has increased the number of permanent residents to be issued visas through the Nova Scotia Provincial Nominee Program (PNP). A total of 700 nominees will receive visas, up from the province’s regular quota of 500.

item.title: In Light of Controversy, Temporary Foreign Worker Program to be Reviewed
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: After a hiring controversy in British Columbia, the Canadian government has announced that it will conduct a review of its Temporary Foreign Worker program.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Presents Immigration Plan for Next Fiscal Year
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has presented its Annual Report to Parliament on Immigration. Each year, this report is given to Canadian Parliament as a way to summarize recent developments in immigration and outline immigration policy for the following year.

item.title: CEC to Play a Prominent Role in Shaping Canadian Immigration in 2013
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has announced plans to maintain its record levels of immigration. CIC plans to admit a total of 240,000 to 265,000 new permanent residents in 2013, matching its targets for the seventh year in a row.

item.title: Rwandan Genocide Participant Deported from Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Jean Leonard Teganya, a Rwandan refugee claimant in Canada, has been deported for complicity in the 1994 Rwandan genocide.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Cracks Down on Marriage Fraud
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: As part of its ongoing efforts to reduce marriage fraud in Canada, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has introduced new legislation related to spousal sponsorship.

item.title: Over 800 Afghan Interpreters and Families Resettled in Canada
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Over 800 Afghans have settled in Canada thanks to a special program created by the Canadian government. The program allowed Afghans who acted as interpreters for Canadian military and diplomatic personnel to live in Canada with their families.

item.title: Immigrant Entrepreneurs Honoured in Ottawa
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Five outstanding immigrant entrepreneurs were bestowed with the first ever Immigrant Entrepreneur Awards ceremony.

item.title: Ontario Wants 135,000 New Immigrants Each Year
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: An expert roundtable on immigration to Ontario has concluded that immigration to the province should be increased to one percent of its population, or approximately 135,000 people a year. Of this number, it is advised that at least 65 to 70 percent come economic immigration classes.

item.title: Canada Seeks to Attract British and Irish Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Immigration Minister Jason Kenney recently traveled to the United Kingdom on a formal business trip. The primary objective of his five-day trip is to encourage young British and Irish graduates to consider coming to Canada to live and work.

item.title: Vancouver’s Reputation is “Best in the World”
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A recent poll of over 18,000 people from the world’s G8 countries revealed that Vancouver tops the list of the world’s most “reputable” cities.

item.title: New Citizenship Language Rules to Take Force in November
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Beginning November 1, 2012, citizenship applicants will have to follow new rules to prove their competency in one of Canada’s official languages.

item.title: Canadian Experience Class Issues 20,000th Visa
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Earlier this month, Canadian Experience Class (CEC) issued its 20,000th visa, a success for one of Canada’s most recent immigration programs.

item.title: Over 3,000 Individuals May Be Stripped of Canadian Citizenship
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Over 3,000 new Canadian citizens may be stripped of their citizenship due to allegations of fraud.

item.title: Natural Resources Fuel 20% of Canada's Economy
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Department of Natural Resources recently released figures that show the importance of resources to Canada’s economy.

item.title: Authorities Uncover Immigration Marriage Fraud
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: 39 individuals in Montreal were charged with participating in a fake marriage scheme. The goal of the scheme was the bring people to Canada by falsifying marriage to a Canadian citizen or permanent resident.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Reviews its Last Twelve Months
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) issued an announcement summarizing its changes in the past 12 months.

item.title: Breaking News: Government Overhauls Economic Immigration, Announces New Program
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) announced today major changes that will amount to an overhaul of the system currently governing economic-based immigration to Canada. In a statement released today, CIC outlined planned changes to the Federal Skilled Worker and Canadian Experience Class programs, as well as the creation of a new immigration program called the Federal Skilled Trades Class.

item.title: New Rule Proposed for Canadian Study Visas
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Government of Canada, in an attempt to eliminate ‘disingenuous’ students, plans to limit the issuance of study visas only to individuals who will study in government-accredited schools.

item.title: Citizenship and Immigration Canada Continues to Expand Settlement Programs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has recently issued a call for proposals for new language training, settlement, and resettlement services. Such programs are integral to helping immigrants integrate into their new homes.

item.title: New Canadians Sworn in at Largest Diversity Festival
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: 84 immigrants became Canadian citizens at the Heritage Days festival in Edmonton, Alberta.

item.title: CIC Launches National Consultations on Immigration
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has launched a series of consultations across the country to discuss issues concerning immigration. The series will be conducted by CIC’s Parliamentary Secretaries, Chungsen Leung and Rick Dykstra.

item.title: Canadian Employers Look to Hire in Portugal
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canadian employers are hoping to hire approximately 400 Portuguese construction workers, according to details divulged by Albano Ribeiro, spokesperson for the Construction Union in Portugal.

item.title: For the First Time, Canadians are Wealthier than Americans
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: A new study has revealed that median household income in Canada is now higher than in the United States.

item.title: Expansion of Canada-Alberta Pilot Project
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Employers in Alberta will soon be able to more easily hire skilled foreign workers in targeted professions. This is thanks to the expansion of the Canada-Alberta Pilot Project, which has been created to better help address Alberta’s labour shortage.

item.title: Canadian Economy Creates High-Paying Jobs
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Since the beginning of 2012, Canada’s job growth has expanded to include a record number of high-quality positions. This is according to a report by the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC).

item.title: Canada Issues a Record Number of Visitor Visas
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada has issued a record number of visitor visas this year. Since the start of the year, over 500,000 visitor visas have been issued.

item.title: Toronto is one of the World’s Most Liveable Cities
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The city of Toronto has been ranked the world’s eighth most liveable city for 2012. This is according to a study released by the Economic Intelligence Unit, which annually reviews cities for the qualities that make them most appealing to residents.

item.title: Canada Takes Steps to Protect At-Risk Workers
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective immediately, Human Resources and Skills Development (ESDC) will be issuing negative Labour Market Opinions for individuals destined to work in fields related to the sex trade. This includes jobs with companies such as strip clubs, escort services, and massage parlors. Beginning on July 14, 2012, ESDC will no longer accept new applications for businesses in these fields.

item.title: Canada, Partner Countries Address Immigration Fraud in India
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada, Australia, and the United Kingdom have joined efforts to educate prospective visitors and immigrants about the dangers of using fraudulent immigration agents.

item.title: Quebec Immigration Programs Still Open: Immigration Continues Despite Federal Freeze
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The majority of the over 60 Canadian immigration programs have, and will continue, to accept applications despite a temporary freeze on the acceptance of applications for the Federal Skilled Worker (FSW) program.

item.title: Breaking: Temporary Moratorium on Some New Immigration Applications
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective July 1, 2012, Citizenship and Immigration Canada will temporarily cease accepting new applications to the Federal Skilled Worker (FSW) and Immigrant Investor programs.

item.title: Government Announces Faster Removal of Foreign Criminals Act
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Minister Jason Kenney introduced new legislation last week that will expedite the removal of certain foreign criminals from Canada, thus ensuring the continued safety and security of Canadians.

item.title: Canada the Best G20 Country to be a Woman
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada is the best country of all the G20 nations to be a woman in, according to a global poll of gender experts. These findings were released in advance of the annual G20 summit, where the world`s 20 largest economies (19 countries plus the European Union) will meet to discuss international affairs.

item.title: Temporary Foreign Worker Units to be Centralized
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Effective July 1, 2012, Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) will be making the Temporary Foreign Worker Units (TFWUs) in Toronto and Montreal the sole points of contact for employers and/or their representatives.

item.title: Canada Ranked World’s 4th Most Peaceful Country
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada is one of the most peaceful countries in the world, according to the annual Global Peace Index (GPI).

item.title: Trade Unions and Oil Sands Industries Announce Agreement to Develop Skilled Work Force
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Canada’s Building Trade Unions and the Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers (CAPP) have announced an agreement to develop a stronger skilled workforce in the oil sands region of the country.

item.title: Additional Visa Office Closures and Procedural Changes
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Nineteen Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) local offices are closed as of June 1, 2012. In addition, front counter services will be eliminated at the remaining open offices.

item.title: Government Closes Buffalo Visa Office
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The current Canadian administration, as part of its ongoing efforts to transform the Canadian immigration system, is closing its Buffalo, New York visa office. This is one of the largest Canadian visa offices in North America, currently responsible for processing thousands of applications each year.

item.title: New Study Shows Canadians Enjoy High Quality of Life
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) has published its annual Better Life Index report. For 2012, it ranked Canada as one of the ten best countries in the world in terms of the quality of life that its citizens enjoy.

item.title: Parent and Grandparent Super Visa Sees Great Success
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) has announced that its new Parent and Grandparent Super Visa program has been incredibly successful in its first six months of operation. Since the program was introduced on December 1, 2012, over 3,500 visas have been issued.

item.title: US and Canada in Talks to Facilitate Cross-Border Business
item.author: webadmin@canadavisa.com (The CanadaVisa Team)
item.description:
On May 14, Canadian Citizenship and Immigration Minister Jason Kenney and American Secretary of Homeland Security Janet Napolitano announced that their countries would begin consultations to facilitate cross-border business interactions.
